items.summary: A US government shutdown — the first in more than six years — begins after Congress fails to pass a measure that would have kept federal funds flowing, threatening tens of thousands of jobs.

items.title: Boy, 3, in serious condition after being hit by car in Bellambi, NSW
items.summary: The three-year-old was airlifted to a Sydney hospital after he was run over by a vehicle reversing out of a driveway in Bellambi.

items.title: Health sector unions develop five-point plan to tackle record ambulance ramping in WA
items.summary: More aged care beds, a bolstered workforce and streamlined patient care are needed to tackle ambulance ramping in Western Australia, the health sector’s unions say.

items.title: EPA to begin 'extensive' lead dust deposit monitoring near Nyrstar smelter and MMG mine
items.summary: Hobart suburbs bordering a zinc smelter and a mining town in north-west Tasmania will undergo human health risk monitoring for lead deposit rates, the state's environment protection watchdog has announced.

items.title: Qantas to close staff bases in Canberra, Hobart and Mildura amid restructure
items.summary: The closure of the three bases will take effect in 2026 and affect about 70 personnel, who will be supported throughout the process, the airline said.

items.title: Vandalism at Wybalenna site on Flinders Island condemned by Aboriginal community, police and politicians
items.summary: Members of the Aboriginal community are reeling after vandals allegedly performed donuts at Wybalenna on Flinders Island.

items.title: Total fire bans in place for large parts of Queensland amid hot, dry conditions
items.summary: An area of southern Queensland larger than Tasmania is under a total fire ban that will be extended from central Queensland to the Gold Coast from Thursday.

items.title: Dan Murphy's receives second knockback over planned Daylesford store
items.summary: Australia's largest retail drinks network has been knocked back for a second time in its legal bid to open a liquor store in the heart of Daylesford.

items.title: Fat Bear Week 2025 won by 32 Chunk, who overcame broken jaw to stack on pounds
items.summary: A hunky brown bear named 32 Chunk has waddled away with the Fat Bear Week title for 2025.

items.title: Army reservist Mitchell John Hogan avoids jail for threatening police officer over WA gun laws
items.summary: A gun enthusiast who rang a WA Police acting inspector who was involved in the state's firearm reforms and told him "we're coming for you" three times is ordered to do community work and undergo counselling.

items.title: Police find 'insufficient evidence' to charge officer in alleged choking complaint
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: Hollywood veteran Bruce Beresford slams Donald Trump's plan for 100pc tariff on movies made outside US
items.summary: Renowned Australian director and screenwriter Bruce Beresford says US President Donald Trump's plan to impose a 100 per cent tariff on all foreign-made movies cannot be done.

items.title: NSW Police Commissioner Mal Lanyon sworn in, vows to tackle organised crime and domestic violence
items.summary: In a ceremony on Wednesday, Police Minister Yasmin Catley paid tribute to the new commissioner, recalling the "bad bastards" he chased down in his career.

items.title: Mount Gambier football referee Bill Stephenson hangs up whistle after 35 years
items.summary: Bill Stephenson started refereeing to support his kids' dreams and he worries abuse will stop more like him from taking up the whistle.

items.title: Powerful Philippines earthquake leaves at least 69 people dead
items.summary: The quake, which struck the central Cebu province, injured many others and sent residents scrambling out of their homes and into the darkness as the intense shaking cut off power.

items.title: AFL ditches centre bounce for men's game, and sub rule after grand final criticism
items.summary: The AFL will no longer have the traditional bouncedown to start men's games, and has also ditched the controversial sub rule.

items.title: Prime minister 'concerned' by reports of Chinese ban on BHP iron ore imports
items.summary: China's state iron ore buyer has ordered steelmakers to pause purchases of iron ore shipments from BHP, according to media reports, as they continue hardball negotiations with the company.

items.title: Rio Tinto's Gladstone coal-fired power station could be retired early
items.summary: Rio Tinto tells workers the Gladstone Power Station could retire six years earlier than expected.

items.title: Widow petitions for MRI machine at regional Queensland hospital
items.summary: A year before her husband died, Helen Schmidt was forced to make a gut-wrenching decision after learning there was no MRI machine at their regional hospital.

items.title: Health battle heralds end of an era for family-run festival favourite Wignalls Wines
items.summary: WA vigneron Rob Wignall, who built a legacy of award-winning Great Southern wines and star-studded music festivals, says it is time to move on.

items.title: Yulella Aboriginal Corporation's 'Vision' shop combats cost of remote living
items.summary: A community group in an outback town is fighting high prices to offer more affordable food, clothing, and other essentials that were previously only available hundreds of kilometres away.

items.title: Many waiting longer than clinically recommended for orthopaedic surgery in Canberra
items.summary: After 36 years working as a house cleaner, Judy Harman needs a knee replacement, but there are hundreds of people in front of her on the wait list for orthopaedic surgery in Canberra.

items.title: Van Gogh painting among 'rarely seen' collection of art to be exhibited in Adelaide
items.summary: A "rarely seen" collection of works from renowned artists Vincent van Gogh, Claude Monet and Henri Matisse will be on display in Adelaide next year, as part of 57 works on loan from the Toledo Museum of Art in the US.

items.title: Why Phoebe Litchfield's first ODI World Cup could signal a new era in Australian cricket
items.summary: Having burst onto the scene as a 16-year-old batting alongside Brian Lara, Phoebe Litchfield was a cricketing prodigy. At her first ODI World Cup, she has a chance to become a world beater.

items.title: Sydney's heritage-listed urinal tells story of Australia's public loos
items.summary: Tucked away at Dawes Point, under Sydney Harbour Bridge, is one of the city's most unexpected heritage-listed sites: a cast-iron urinal.

items.title: WA Police find 'insufficient evidence' to charge officer in alleged choking complaint after road incident
items.summary: A man who alleges he was choked by an off-duty police officer in front of his daughter says he has lost trust in the police force, after they found "insufficient evidence" to lay charges over the road incident.

items.title: India beats Sri Lanka in Women's Cricket World Cup opener after rain delays
items.summary: India recovers from a disastrous collapse to beat Sri Lanka in a rain-shortened first game at the Women's Cricket World Cup in Guwahati.

items.title: Lithgow schools teach teenagers to build drones in transition away from coal
items.summary: Students are looking to aero technology for new skills in Lithgow, where almost half the local economy is driven by the declining coal industry.

items.title: How Shane Perry worked as a mortgage broker, played without a contract and helped Brisbane to an NRL premiership
items.summary: Only three men have steered Brisbane to a premiership, and Shane Perry is the only one who has done it while working a full-time job and playing without a contract.

items.title: Nicole Kidman files for divorce from Keith Urban after 19 years of marriage
items.summary: The Oscar-winning actor files for divorce in a Nashville court a day after reports emerged of the couple's separation, with a source saying the decision to leave was Keith Urban's.

items.title: South Australia looks to defend Sheffield Shield and One Day Cup titles
items.summary: South Australia is looking to repeat its success and win the Sheffield Shield title, after a decade-breaking win last season.

items.title: Australia's southern coast is in uncharted waters
items.summary: The disastrous algal bloom that has been lapping at South Australia's shores has turned a coastline into a frontline, leaving many swimmers, surfers and seaside business operators wondering what the upcoming summer will look like.

items.title: When do I need to do my tax return by? Here's what you need to know
items.summary: The 2024/25 tax deadline is fast approaching, and missing the cut-off date could end up costing you. Here's what you need to know.

items.title: Kiama resident launches petition to disqualify MPs convicted of serious crimes
items.summary: Disgraced former MP Gareth Ward was paid a weekly salary of more than $3,000 while waiting to be sentenced for sexual offences. An Illawarra resident wants to ensure that never happens again.

items.title: Oscar Piastri feeling positive ahead of Formula 1 Singapore Grand Prix
items.summary: Oscar Piastri believes McLaren "on paper" should be suited to the high temperatures expected for this weekend's Formula 1 Singapore Grand Prix.

items.title: Two years since Tasmania's commission of inquiry, report reveals which recommendations are still underway
items.summary: Victim-survivor Katrina Munting says she remains hopeful, but she is concerned the government isn't implementing the commission of inquiry's recommendations quickly enough.

items.title: Australia and Türkiye try to break diplomatic stalemate over COP31 climate summit hosting rights
items.summary: Australia and Türkiye are at loggerheads over who will host the massive international event, with insiders suggesting the countries could share the hosting rights.

items.title: Inside a children's court, a magistrate hears of fearful victims and young people living with trauma
items.summary: The ABC spent a week inside the court that presides over youth crime and witnessed fearful victims, young people living with trauma and magistrates facing the difficult to decision to bail or remand.

items.title: When it comes to business, size does matter — and smaller isn't necessarily better
items.summary: The economic contribution of start-ups has been overlooked, as a new study suggests age and performance should be taken into consideration when it comes to incentive policy.

items.title: Communications Minister Anika Wells finds herself in the eye of Optus political storm
items.summary: Touted in some insider circles as future Labor leadership material, self-identified millennial Anika Wells finds herself in a storm over the nation's emergency triple-0 system.

items.title: Will Australia's democracy survive global collapse?
items.summary: This year's Boyer Lectures will consider whether our democratic system will hold in the face of global headwinds.

items.title: $50m fund for clean energy apprenticeships remains untouched
items.summary: A $50 million fund to support students wanting to study clean energy trades is yet to pay out a single dollar, nearly a year and a half after it was funded in the budget.

items.title: Public prostate cancer patients told treatment provided by public hospitals no longer available
items.summary: Men with aggressive prostate cancer who were being treated with a groundbreaking drug have been told the therapy is no longer available at public hospitals.

items.title: AI tool detects tiny brain lesions to help children with epilepsy live seizure-free
items.summary: Melbourne researchers test a new AI tool that detects tiny lesions in children with epilepsy, leading to surgeries that leave them seizure-free.

items.title: Hegseth declares an end to 'politically correct' leadership in the US military
items.summary: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth summoned hundreds of US military officials to an in-person meeting to declare an end to "woke" culture in the military.

items.title: More sunscreens pulled from shelves over SPF concerns
items.summary: Ten further sunscreens have either been pulled from shelves or "paused" from supply to retailers over concerns about their sun protection claims, the Therapeutic Goods Administration (TGA) announces.

items.title: Tuesday finance with Alan Kohler
items.summary: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

items.title: RBA governor Michele Bullock warns housing supply improvement is likely to be several years away
items.summary: In a rare candid moment, the Reserve Bank governor concedes that, despite the best efforts of policy makers, chronic housing undersupply will continue for at least the next two years.

items.title: Michele Bullock on relationship between interest rates and property prices.

items.title: Hundreds gather in Morwell to remember life of 18-year-old Kaiden Morgan
items.summary: Friends and family have gathered in Victoria's east to remember the life of a beloved young man who died in an alleged attack on the weekend.

items.title: Clean-up underway after 'devastating' industrial spill in Far North Queensland
items.summary: Building company Boral works to clean up thousands of litres of kerosene and bitumen that have spilled into a creek in Cairns, connecting to an inlet that leads to the Great Barrier Reef.

items.title: Nicole Kidman and Keith Urban separate after 19 years of marriage
items.summary: A source close to the couple tells the ABC the separation was not a mutual decision, saying it was Urban's decision to leave the relationship.

items.title: Kash Patel gave New Zealand officials 3D-printed guns illegal to possess under local laws
items.summary: On a visit to New Zealand in July, FBI Director Kash Patel presented three senior security officials with 3D-printed guns that were later destroyed.

items.title: Melbourne Storm and Brisbane Broncos name NRL grand finals teams, NRLW teams announced
items.summary: Brisbane Broncos' mid-year recruit Ben Talty has been dropped for this Sunday's NRL grand final, making way for the returning Pat Carrigan.

items.title: Jessica Ann Walker among trio accused of murdering Jayden Selfe in Attadale
items.summary: Pictured riding on a luxury boat and posing on the deck of a multi-million-dollar home with sweeping views of the Swan River, life appeared good for Jessica Ann Walker in 2022 — but just three years later she would be charged with murdering a man.

items.title: Speaking to others without kids helped me find a future after IVF
items.summary: The more people I spoke to, the less frightened I felt of my future. I could shift my focus to what I can do because I don't have a kid, instead of what I was missing out on.

items.title: West Coast Eagles handed extra draft pick, four rookie list spots to help climb up ladder
items.summary: The West Coast Eagles are handed an extra first-round draft pick and four additional rookie list spots from the AFL, in a bid to help the ailing club return to competitiveness after four dismal years.

items.title: Australia ready to defend Women's Cricket World Cup trophy in India
items.summary: Australia's all-conquering generation of women's cricketers has one last Cricket World Cup feat to tick off, setting their sights on defying almost 40 years of history to win back-to-back ODI tournaments.

items.title: Stolen WWII ledger returned to St Luke's church in Toowoomba
items.summary: The historic ledger, which bears the names of Toowoomba locals who served in WWII, went missing a month ago, but now it is back in safe hands thanks to a string of unlikely coincidences.

items.title: 'Complex' brief of evidence after group charged with stealing crocodile eggs from Kakadu National Park
items.summary: Four men, including a pilot who survived a fatal chopper crash in 2022, are facing Commonwealth charges for allegedly stealing saltwater crocodile eggs from Kakadu National Park.

items.title: Missing boy's family releases statement as search continues in mid-north SA
items.summary: The devastated family of a missing four-year-old boy has released a statement saying it is holding on to hope "he will be found and returned safely" as authorities and community members continue the search in mid-north South Australia.

items.title: Geelong is known for its accessibility on Mad Monday, but Bailey Smith's posts have unravelled years of goodwill
items.summary: Geelong forged years of goodwill via its accessibility to Mad Monday — now the club faces a mess that it never saw coming.

items.title: How Brisbane's culture of empowerment has allowed its youngsters to be fearless on the AFL's biggest stage
items.summary: Brisbane's youngest players rise to the occasion on the biggest stage, led by its 21-year-old Norm Smith medallist Will Ashcroft. Here's how the two-time premiers allow their kids to thrive.

items.title: NSW government loses music festival strip search case as woman awarded $93,000 in damages
items.summary: A Sydney woman subjected to an unlawful strip search at a music festival has been awarded $93,000 in damages, in a judgement that could see thousands of others also receive compensation.
